skill.name: docs-review
skill.description: Review documentation changes for compliance with the Metabase writing style guide. Use when reviewing pull requests, files, or diffs containing documentation markdown files.
skill.summary: Review documentation changes for compliance with the Metabase writing style guide. Use when reviewin...
skill.author: metabase

security_audit.summary: This is a prompt-based documentation review skill containing only markdown instructions for AI agents. No executable code, no network calls, no external commands, and no file system access beyond standard AI tool capabilities. The listed tools (Read, Grep, Bash, Glob) are appropriate for documentation review tasks.

content.value_statement: Documentation reviews take time and can miss style issues. This skill provides a structured checklist to review markdown files against the Metabase writing style guide. It catches tone, structure, formatting, and clarity issues efficiently.
actual_capabilities: Review markdown files against Metabase writing style guide
Check tone and voice for conversational language
Detect formatting issues like links in headings and ampersand misuse
Identify structural problems including vague headings and buried important information
Provide numbered feedback for easy reference and tracking
Integrate with GitHub pull request review workflow
limitations: Requires access to Read and Grep tools for file analysis
GitHub PR integration requires mcp__github__ tools
Does not execute code or modify files

use_cases.title: Self-review before submitting
use_cases.description: Contributors check their markdown changes for style compliance before opening a pull request

use_cases.title: PR review workflow
use_cases.description: Maintainers use pending review workflow to post numbered style feedback directly on GitHub pull requests

use_cases.title: Batch file review
use_cases.description: Writers review multiple documentation files for consistency with the Metabase writing style guide

prompt_templates.title: Quick file review
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the docs-review skill to review this markdown file for Metabase style guide compliance

prompt_templates.title: Diff review
prompt_templates.scenario: Review changes in a git diff
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the docs-review skill to review the changed files in this diff for style violations

prompt_templates.title: PR review mode
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the docs-review skill to review the markdown documentation changes in this pull request using GitHub integration

prompt_templates.title: Batch scan
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the docs-review skill to scan all markdown files in the docs directory for style guide compliance

output_examples.input: Review this markdown file for style compliance
output: Issue 1: Formal tone - Line 15: Consider using 'cannot' instead of 'cannot' for a more conversational tone
Issue 2: Vague heading - Line 8: Heading could be more specific. Try stating the point directly
Issue 3: Link text - Line 23: Avoid linking the word 'here'. Use descriptive link text instead

best_practices: Only flag issues that will make a material difference to the reader
Number all issues sequentially from Issue 1 for easy reference
In PR mode, post all comments in a single response for cohesive feedback
anti_patterns: Flagging every minor style nit instead of significant issues
Ignoring the review mode detection and using wrong workflow
Skipping the numbered format requirement which enables efficient issue tracking

faq.question: Which AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. GitHub PR integration requires the mcp__github__ MCP tools.

faq.question: What file types can this skill review?
faq.answer: The skill reviews markdown documentation files (.md). It does not review other file types.

faq.question: How do I use the GitHub PR review mode?
faq.answer: Ensure mcp__github__ tools are available. The skill automatically detects this and uses the pending review workflow.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill only reads files you provide access to. It does not send data externally or execute arbitrary code.

faq.question: What if the GitHub MCP tools are not available?
faq.answer: The skill detects missing tools and falls back to local review mode, outputting numbered issues to the conversation.

faq.question: How is this different from other documentation linters?
faq.answer: This skill provides AI-powered contextual review that understands nuance. It catches issues like tone and structure that automated linters miss.
